solution.hint.para: Substitute 2 for t to obtain the location of the particle at time 2.

problem.para: At time 2 the particle's location is the point (9,0,3).
The velocity vector of the motion is \mathbf{v}=(4,-1,2).
The velocity vector of the motion is \mathbf{v}=(1,2,-1).
Suppose a linear motion travels 10m during the time interval [4,5].
How far will it travel during the time interval [8,9]?

solution.para: A linear motion is a constant speed motion. So this particular motion will travel a distance of 10m during any time interval of length 1. In particular, in the time interval [8,9] it will travel a distance of 10m.

problem.para: How far will it travel in the time interval [0,15].

solution.para: The time interval [0,15] has length 15. So, in this time space, the particle will travel 15 times the distance it travels in a time interval of length 1.
Therefore the particle will travel 150m in the time interval [0,15].

problem.para: How far will the particle travel in the time interval [-10,20]?

answer.para: A will travel a distance of 300m.
